text: The Amga (; ) is a river in Sakha (Yakutia), Russia. The length of the river is . The area of its basin is . The Amga freezes up in the first half of October and stays under the ice until May. ==Course== The river has its source in the Aldan Highlands. It forms the eastern limit of the Lena Plateau. It is the biggest tributary of the Aldan, which it joins on the left bank a few miles west of Khandyga.Приленское плато, Great Soviet Encyclopedia {| |- valign="top" |In some stretches river Amga is flanked by pillar-like rock formations. |} ==See also== *List of rivers of Russia ==References== ==External links== * Category:Rivers of the Sakha Republic
